metadata.title: CVE-2020-13791 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: hw/pci/pci.c in QEMU 4.2.0 allows guest OS users to trigger an out-of-bounds access by providing an address near the end of the PCI configuration space.

advisory.discovered_by: Ren Ding, Hanqing Zhao, Yi Ren

notes.note: mdeslaur> as of 2022-01-05, the proposed fix has not been commited while the CVE description mentions hw/pci/pci.c, that is incorrect, the CVE is assigned to the hw/display/ati.c issue, the patch to hw/pci/pci.c is just a defense in depth fix.

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
